intro: Hoya tiatuilaensis, commonly known as the Tiatuila Hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Hoya tiatuilaensis is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on the surface of other plants without being parasitic. It is relatively rare and is often cultivated by enthusiasts due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
